scope_of_work.problem: Replacement floor tiles required due to equipment being removed from DC areas at Warwick. Floor tiles required to cover over tiles that have become damaged and worn over time at the location
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply of floor tiles to be used as equipment is taken away from site.

Supply of 130 BEX600V PSA Ex Heavy Grade 44mm High Density Particle Board Core 600  600 Full Depth Edge Banded Panel with Factory Bonded Forbo Colurex White

70 BEX600V PSA Ex Heavy Grade 44mm High Density Particle Board Core 600 600 Full Depth Edge Banded Panel with Factory Bonded Forbo Colurex Blue
scope_of_work.justification: If tiles are not supplied then the floor will become a safety hazard to anyone in the DC areas
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Floor tiles with holes or that are damaged will not be able to be replaced. The DC floor will be a health and safety concern if these are not replaced

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Upon running the Phase 1 Generators we found that the fuel pipework in the Bulk oil store had developed a leak from the 45 degree joint at high level, just as it enters the bund pipework. The pipework in question tops up the day tanks so we do not run low on fuel in the event of a fault to site where generators would be called upon to run and manage site load, or in the monthly maintaining of the generators when we run them.
scope_of_work.scope:
Engineers to attend site to supply and install a pipe repair bandage which is a 
composite fibreglass wrap with a water-activated resin which sets rock hard in 
minutes to provide high-strength reinforcement of leaking or damaged pipes.

As pipework is 4 meters in height a scaffolder will attend site to build a safe 
working platform.
scope_of_work.justification: If we do not do a repair on the area the pipework is leaking, we would struggle to top up the day tanks in the event of a mains failure to site or in the running of maintenance on the generators. If we did try to run the fuel from the main tank to the day tank we would then be faced with the fuel leaking from high level and it would then have the potential to create an environmental issue as it would be hard to contain due to it tracking across containment below the pipework and finding different routes / location's to drip down from.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: If we do not do a repair on the area the pipework is leaking, we would struggle to top up the day tanks in the event of a mains failure to site or in the running of maintenance on the generators. If we did try to run the fuel from the main tank to the day tank we would then be faced with the fuel leaking from high level and it would then have the potential to create an environmental issue as it would be hard to contain due to it tracking across containment below the pipework and finding different routes / location's to drip down from.

If not approved, the effect would be: If we do not do a repair on the area the pipework is leaking, we would struggle to top up the day tanks in the event of a mains failure to site or in the running of maintenance on the generators. input.project_name: UPM-DRUPS3 Triple Split DX System - Jul 22
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Terence Murray MD (2):work order closed by Terence Murray MD (3):work planning by Terence Murray MD (4):offer approved by Terence Murray MD (5):offer submitted by Terence Murray MD (6):work in progress by Terence Murray MD

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS3 Switch Room Triple Split DX System (Mitsubishi Heavy) has failed and lost its R410A F-Gas charge.
scope_of_work.scope: Replace DRUPS3 Triple Split DX System with a new system that runs on R32 F-Gas.
scope_of_work.justification: DRUPS3 Switch Room requires resilient cooling to prevent the supply choke from overheating. The existing (failed) system is approaching the end of its serviceable life and some replacement spare parts are now obsolete.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased loss of resilience to DRUPS3 Switch Room cooling. Potential loss of DRUPS3 if the Switch Room overheats - and reduction of site DRUPS resilience from N+1 to N.
